review.title: Neutrosophic soft sets with applications in decision making
review.abstract: In this paper, firstly we present Maji's definitions \cite{maji-2013} and verify that that some propositions are incorrect by a counterexample. We then redefine concept of neutrosophic soft set and their operation based on \c{C}a\u{g}man \cite{cagman-2014} and investigate some properties of these operations. We then construct an decision making method and group decision making which selects an optimum element from the alternatives by using weights of parameters. We finally present an example which shows that the method can be successfully applied to many problems that contain uncertainties

sections.heading: 1 Introduction
sections.text: Many problems, including uncertainties, are a major problem in many areas of real life such as economics, engineering, the environment, social sciences, medicine, and corporate governance. Unsafe data in these areas could be caused by complexity and difficulties in classical mathematical modeling. To avoid difficulties in dealing with uncertainties, many tools have been studied by researchers. Some of these tools are neutral propositions [18], neutral propositions [16], and intuitionist neutral propositions [1]. Fuzzy sets and intuitionist fuzzy sets are characterized by membership functions, membership, and non-membership functions. In some real life problems for correctly describing an object in an uncertain and ambiguous environment, we must deal with the ambiguous and incomplete information.

sections.heading: 6 Conclusion
sections.text: In this paper, we first examine the Neutrosophic Soft Sets [11] prescribed by Maji and then redefine the concept of Neutrosopic Soft Sets and Neutrosopic Soft Sets. Finally, we present two applications of Neutrosopic Soft Sets in the decision-making problem.

In 2014, Çağman [4] redefined soft sets using the single parameter set and compared definitions with those defined before.

Maji [11] combined the concept of soft set and neutrosophic set together by introducing a new concept called neutrosophic soft set and gave an application of neutrosophic soft set in decision making problem.

metadata.abstractText: We firstly present definitions and properties in study of Maji [11] on neutrosophic soft sets. We then give a few notes on his study. Next, based on Çağman [4], we redefine the notion of neutrosophic soft set and neutrosophic soft set operations to make more functional. By using these new definitions we construct a decision making method and a group decision making method which selects a set of optimum elements from the alternatives. We finally present examples which shows that the methods can be successfully applied to many problems that contain uncertainties.
